title: Add Default Lint to Ensure Match Arm Bindings do not Shadow Local Variables.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
Given the following code:

```rust
fn foo(x: u32) -> u32 {
  let a = 100;
  let b = 200;
  let c = 300;

  match x {
      c => 3,
      b => 2,
      a => 1,
      _ => 0
  }
}
```

we currently emit:

```rust
warning: unreachable pattern
 --> <source>:8:7
  |
7 |       c => 3,
  |       - matches any value
8 |       b => 2,
  |       ^ unreachable pattern
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unreachable_patterns)]` on by default
```

However, in this case, the developer was likely confused and thought they were matching on the value of `c`, not creating a binding of with name `c`. We should emit something more similar to:

```rust
warning: match arm binding shadows local binding
 --> <source>:8:7
  |
7 |       c => 3,
  |       ^
  = note: shadows local binding `c` declared at <source>:4:7
  = note: `#[warn(arm_binding_shadows_local)]` on by default

```
